info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 11:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Putnam, southeastern Henry and southwestern Bureau Counties through NOON CDT... At 1125 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kewanee, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buda around 1140 AM CDT. Wyanet around 1145 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tiskilwa. This includes Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 37 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Illinois.
